Package utils

Class HelperMethods

java.lang.Object
utils.HelperMethods
public class HelperMethods extends Object
This class is full of various methods that will be called by more than just one entity, object, or class
Author:
John Botonakis and Sean-Paul Brown

  • Constructor Details

    • HelperMethods

      public HelperMethods()

  • Method Details

    • canMoveHere

      public static boolean canMoveHere(float x, float y, float width, float height, int[][] levelData)
      Checks whether an entity is able to move in a given direction, by checking every corner of the entities hitbox for a collision with another sprite. The order of checks is: Top left, Bottom right, Top right, Bottom left.
      Parameters:
      x - - X-Position of caller entity
      y - - Y-Position of caller entity
      width - - Width of the hitbox of caller entity
      height - - Height of the hitbox of caller entity
      levelData - - 2D Array of data that represents the level
      Returns:
      - True if the entity is able to move, false if it cannot

    • isSolid

      private static boolean isSolid(float x, float y, int[][] lvlData)
      Determines if a tile is solid enough to walk on
      Parameters:
      x - - X-Position of the current entity
      y - - Y-Position of the current entity
      lvlData - - Data of the level to be checked against
      Returns:
      - True if it is able to be walked on, false otherwise

    • isTileSolid

      private static boolean isTileSolid(int xIndex, int yIndex, int[][] levelData)
      This method will check a specific index in the levelData passed in. If it is not in the tiles being used or is NOT a transparent tile, it is solid.
      Parameters:
      xIndex - - X-Position in the level index; Any drawn game tile on the X-Axis
      yIndex - - Y-Position in the level index; Any drawn game tile on the Y-Axis
      levelData - - The data that makes up the level
      Returns:
      - Returns True if the tile is solid, false otherwise

    • getXPosWall

      public static float getXPosWall(Rectangle2D.Float hitbox, float xSpeed)
      Checks when a hitbox collides with something on the right or left side
      Parameters:
      hitbox - - The hitbox calling this collision check
      xSpeed - - The X speed of that hitbox
      Returns:
      - The offset of the hitbox as to not clip through

    • getYPosRoof

      public static float getYPosRoof(Rectangle2D.Float hitbox, float airSpeed, float hitboxOffset)
      Checks when the caller's hitbox collides with something on the top or bottom, usually after jumping and hitting the ceiling, or jumping and landing on the floor
      Parameters:
      hitbox - - The hitbox calling this collision check
      airSpeed - - The Y Speed of that hitbox
      hitboxOffset - - How much the sprite is drawn off center from the hitbox
      Returns:
      - Returns a float to displace the caller's hitbox.

    • floorCheck

      public static boolean floorCheck(Rectangle2D.Float hitbox, int[][] lvlData)
      Checks to see if the entity is on the floor
      Parameters:
      hitbox - - The hitbox of the entity that called this method
      lvlData - - The data of the floor
      Returns:
      - Returns true if the entity is touching the floor, false if not

    • isSightClear

      public static boolean isSightClear(int[][] levelData, Rectangle2D.Float firstHitbox, Rectangle2D.Float secondHitbox, int yTile)
      This determines if one Entity can see another Entity's hitbox in a Level. It will then determine if all of the tiles between the two points are walkable. If so, it will return true. If not, false.
      Parameters:
      levelData - - the current Level as a 2D int array
      firstHitbox - - the first Hitbox from one of the Entities to check
      secondHitbox - - the other Hitbox from the other Entity
      yTile - - the yTile of the first hitbox
      Returns:
      true if there is a clear line of sight between both hitboxes

    • isTileWalkable

      public static boolean isTileWalkable(Rectangle2D.Float hitbox, float xSpeed, int[][] lvlData)
      Check if a tile is walkable based on the xSpeed given into the function.
      Parameters:
      hitbox - - The hitbox of the caller entity
      xSpeed - - The current X-Speed of the caller entity
      lvlData - - The data that makes up the current level
      Returns:
      true if the specific tile xSpeed away is walkable

    • isAllTilesWalkable

      public static boolean isAllTilesWalkable(int xStart, int xEnd, int y, int[][] lvlData)
      Checking the row of tiles so make sure that all are walkable
      Parameters:
      xStart - - The starting X-Coordinate
      xEnd - - The ending X-Coordinate
      y - - The Y-Position of both entities
      lvlData - - The data that makes up the current level
      Returns:
      return true if all of the tiles are walkable from xStart to xEnd
